Wisdom: اسْتَكْثِرْ مِنَ الْمَحَامِدِ فَإِنَّ الْمَذَامَّ قَلَّ مَنْ يَنْجُو مِنْهَا
enWisdom: Try to increase your praiseworthy actions [and traits], for verily disgraceful actions [and traits] are such that very few gain salvation from them

Wisdom: احْذَرْ كُلَّ أَمْرٍ إِذَا ظَهَرَ أَزْرَى بِفَاعِلِهِ وَحَقَّرَهُ
enWisdom: Be wary of every matter that degrades the one who performs it when it becomes apparent, and abases him

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَخُبْثَ الطَّوِيَّةِ وَإِفْسَادَ [وَ فَسَادَ] النِّيَّةِ وَرُكُوبَ الدَّنِيَّةِ وَغُرُورَ الْأُمْنِيَّةِ
enWisdom: Beware of a wicked heart, corruption of intention, embarking on vice and the deception of [false] aspiration

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ النَّجْوَى مَا كَانَ عَلَى الدِّينِ وَالتُّقَى وَأَسْفَرَ عَنِ اتِّبَاعِ الْهُدَى وَمُخَالَفَةِ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The best secret discussion is that which is founded on religion and God-wariness, and is based on following the path of guidance and opposing vain desires

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْعَافِيَةَ فِي الدِّينِ وَالدُّنْيَا لَنِعْمَةٌ جَلِيلَةٌ وَمَوْهِبَةٌ جَزِيلَةٌ
enWisdom: Verily well-being in religion and [in] this world is a great (or beautiful) blessing and a bountiful gift

Wisdom: إِذَا رَأَيْتَ فِي غَيْرِكَ خُلُقاً ذَمِيماً فَتَجَنَّبْ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ أَمْثَالَهُ
enWisdom: When you see in others a quality which is objectionable, then keep similar qualities away from yourself

Wisdom: تَعَصَّبُوا لِخِلَالِ الْحَمْدِ مِنَ الْحِفْظِ لِلْجَارِ وَالْوَفَاءِ بِالذِّمَامِ وَالطَّاعَةِ لِلْبِرِّ [لِلْخَيْرِ] وَالْمَعْصِيَةِ لِلْكِبْرِ وَتَحَلَّوْا بِمَكَارِمِ الْخِلَالِ
enWisdom: You should be zealous for praiseworthy qualities like protecting the [rights of the] neighbour, fulfilling the sureties, obedience to virtue and opposition to arrogance; and beautify yourselves with excellent traits

Wisdom: تَبَادَرُوا إِلَى مَحَامِدِ الْأَفْعَالِ وَفَضَائِلِ الْخِلَالِ وَتَنَافَسُوا فِي صِدْقِ الْأَقْوَالِ وَبَذْلِ الْأَمْوَالِ
enWisdom: Hasten towards praiseworthy actions and virtuous traits, and vie for truthful speech and generous giving

Wisdom: تَحَرَّ مِنْ أَمْرِكَ مَا يَقُومُ بِهِ عُذْرُكَ وَتَثْبُتُ بِهِ حُجَّتُكَ وَيَفِي‏ءُ إِلَيْكَ بِرُشْدِكَ
enWisdom: Seek in your work the course by which your excuse may be credible, your evidence may be established and your integrity may be restored

Wisdom: خُذْ مِنْ أَمْرِكَ مَا يَقُومُ بِهِ عُذْرُكَ وَتَثْبُتُ بِهِ حُجَّتُكَ
enWisdom: Take of your matter that which makes your excuse credible and establishes your proof

Wisdom: حَيَاءٌ يَرْتَفِعُ وَعَوْرَاتٌ تَجْتَمِعُ [وَ] أَشْبَهُ شَيْ‏ءٍ بِالْجُنُونِ الْإِصْرَارُ عَلَيْهِ هَرَمٌ وَالْإِفَاقَةُ مِنْهُ نَدَمٌ ثَمَرَةُ حَلَالِهِ الْوَلَدُ إِنْ عَاشَ فَتَنَ وَإِنْ مَاتَ حَزَنَ
enWisdom: He (‘a) was asked about intercourse, so he said: [It is] shame that is lifted, loins that are joined and the closest thing to insanityPersistence in it makes one senile and revival from it brings regretWhen lawful, its fruit is a son who, if he lives, subjects [one] to trial and if he dies, causes sadness

Wisdom: خَيْرُ الثَّنَاءِ مَا جَرَى عَلَى أَلْسِنَةِ الْأَبْرَارِ
enWisdom: The best praise is that which flows from the tongues of the righteous

Wisdom: ذِلَّ فِي نَفْسِكَ وَعَزَّ فِي دِينِكَ وَصُنْ آخِرَتَكَ وَابْذُلْ دُنْيَاكَ
enWisdom: Have humility in your soul and honour in your faith; preserve your Hereafter and be open-handed with your worldly possessions

Wisdom: شَيْئَانِ لَا يَعْرِفُ فَضْلَهُمَا إِلَّا مَنْ فَقَدَهُمَا الشَّبَابُ وَالْعَافِيَةُ
enWisdom: Two things whose value is not understood except by the one who has lost them are youth and health

Wisdom: كُنْ مِنَ الْكَرِيمِ عَلَى حَذَرٍ إِنْ أَهَنْتَهُ وَمِنَ اللَّئِيمِ إِنْ أَكْرَمْتَهُ وَمِنَ الْحَلِيمِ إِنْ أَخْرَجْتَهُ
enWisdom: Be cautious of the noble-minded person if you offend him, and of the wicked one if you honour him and of the forbearing one if you force him into a difficult position

Wisdom: كُنْ كَالنَّحْلَةِ إِذَا أَكَلَتْ أَكَلَتْ طَيِّباً وَإِذَا وَضَعَتْ وَضَعَتْ طَيِّباً وَإِذَا وَقَعَتْ عَلَى عُودٍ لَمْ تَكْسِرْهُ
enWisdom: Be like the bee when it eats it eats what is good and when it secretes it secretes what is good, and when it sits on a twig it does not break it
For every good deed there is recompense

Wisdom: لَنْ تُدْرِكَ الْكَمَالَ حَتَّى تَرْقَى عَنِ النَّقْصِ
enWisdom: You will never attain perfection until you rise above imperfection
What a rescinder sleep is for the resolutions of the day!

Wisdom: مَا لَا يَنْبَغِي أَنْ تَفْعَلَهُ فِي الْجَهْرِ فَلَا تَفْعَلْهُ فِي السِّرِّ
enWisdom: That which is not appropriate for you to do in the open should not be done by you in private

Wisdom: مِسْكِينٌ ابْنُ آدَمَ مَكْتُومُ الْأَجَلِ مَكْنُونُ الْعِلَلِ [الْفِعْلِ‏] مَحْفُوظُ الْعَمَلِ تُولِمُهُ الْبَقَّةُ وَتُنْتِنُهُ الْعَرَقَةُ وَتَقْتُلُهُ الشَّرَقَةُ
enWisdom: ) How wretched the son of Adam is! His death is hidden, his ailments concealed, his every action recorded, harmed by the bite of a mosquito, made malodorous by perspiration and caused to die by [something as simple as] choking

Wisdom: وَيْحَ ابْنِ آدَمَ أَسِيرُ الْجُوعِ صَرِيعُ الشِّبَعِ غَرَضُ الْآفَاتِ خَلِيفَةُ الْأَمْوَاتِ
enWisdom: ) Woe to the son of Adam! A prisoner of hunger, prone to overeating, a target of calamities and a successor of the dead

Wisdom: يَكْثُرُ حَلْفُ الرَّجُلِ لِأَرْبَعٍ مَهَانَةٍ يَعْرِفُهَا مِنْ نَفْسِهِ أَوْ ضَرَاعَةٍ يَجْعَلُهَا سَبِيلًا إِلَى تَصْدِيقِهِ أَوْ عَيٍّ لِمَنْطِقِهِ فَيَتَّخِذُ الْأَيْمَانَ حَشْواً وَصِلَةً لِكَلَامِهِ أَوْ لِتُهْمَةٍ قَدْ عُرِفَ بِهَا
enWisdom: The swearing of a man increases for four [possible reasons]: something shameful that he knows about himself, or as a means of entreating by which he may be deemed truthful, or because of his inability to express himself so he takes oaths as verbiage to connect his speech, or because of an accusation that has been made upon him
The one who hits the mark, achieves and the one who errs, loses
One who is [overly] careful [not to put himself in any harm] is thrown [into it]
Dread is [a cause of] failure
Warning is vindication
The innocent one is fearless
The one who exposes himself to affliction puts himself in danger
The daring risk-taker charges towards danger
A good dream is one of the two [forms of] glad-tidings
Dreams may [at times] come true
A beautiful countenance is the first of the two felicities
good countenance is the beginning of felicity
A good countenance is an apparent beauty
A comfortable mode of transport is one of the two comforts
Be steadfast [and loyal] in fulfilling your pledges

Wisdom: احْذَرُوا صَوْلَةَ الْكَرِيمِ إِذَا جَاعَ وَأَشَرَ اللَّئِيمِ إِذَا شَبِعَ
enWisdom: Be cautious of the assault of the noble-minded person when he is hungry and the insolence of the wicked one when he is satiated

Wisdom: احْذَرُوا سَطْوَةَ الْكَرِيمِ إِذَا وُضِعَ وَسَوْرَةَ اللَّئِيمِ إِذَا رُفِعَ
enWisdom: Be cautious of the authority of the noble-minded person when he is humiliated and the vehemence of the wicked one when he is elevated [to a position of power]

Wisdom: احْذَرُوا نِفَارَ النِّعَمِ فَمَا كُلُّ شَارِدٍ بِمَرْدُودٍ
enWisdom: Beware of the slipping away of blessings, for not everything that runs away comes back

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمَا قَلَّ إِنْكَارُهُ وَإِنْ كَثُرَ مِنْكَ اعْتِذَارُهُ فَمَا كُلُّ قَائِلٍ نُكْراً يُمْكِنُكَ أَنْ تُوسِعَهُ عُذْراً
enWisdom: Keep away from that for which there is little denial, even if the excuses from you are many, for it is not such that everyone who speaks ill [of you] can be excused by you

Wisdom: أَبْلَغُ الشَّكْوَى مَا نَطَقَ بِهِ ظَاهِرُ الْبَلْوَى
enWisdom: The most apprising complaint is that which is enunciated by manifest affliction

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا أَبَادَ الْقُرُونَ تَعَاقُبُ الْحَرَكَاتِ وَالسُّكُونِ
enWisdom: Verily the previous generations were only wiped out by the alternation of movements and stillness
Whenever you fear the created [as opposed to the Creator], you flee from him
By turning towards [Allah] misfortunes are warded off
A person’s distance from vice is [the source of his] magnanimity
Expecting relief is one of the two comforts
Beauty of the freeman is [in] keeping away from dishonour
The best of qualities is the most agreeable of them
One who gauges [the people] detests (or keeps away from) [them]

Wisdom: رُبَّ مُتَحَرِّزٍ مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ فِيهِ آفَتُهُ
enWisdom: NULL
Sometimes the matter that is pursued and [its] acquisition become difficult
Embarking on acts that lead to [places of] destruction is the symbol of foolishness
Counter hard-heartedness with gentleness

Wisdom: عِنْدَ تَصْحِيحِ الضَّمَائِرِ يَبْدُو غِلُّ السَّرَائِرِ
enWisdom: When the consciences are being reformed, the hidden rancour becomes evident

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يَظْلِمُ نَفْسَهُ كَيْفَ يُنْصِفُ غَيْرَهُ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who oppresses his own soul, how can he be fair to others?!
In the unseen there is wonder
In every blessing there is a reward
At times even a good steed may stumble
Tribulation may come suddenly
At times, tribulation may abase [a person]
At times the matters that are pursued are regarded with displeasure
The near one may [at times] become distanced
At times the crooked may become straight
A deluded person may [sometimes] remain unharmed
Sometimes matters become prevalent (or obscure)

Wisdom: قَدْ يَكْذِبُ الرَّجُلُ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ عِنْدَ شِدَّةِ الْبَلَاءِ بِمَا لَمْ يَفْعَلْهُ
enWisdom: A person may lie about himself regarding that which he did not do when he is faced with severe tribulation
How many a coveter covets pardon

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ خَائِفٍ وَفَدَ بِهِ خَوْفُهُ عَلَى قَرَارِهِ الْأَمْنِ
enWisdom: How many a fearful person has been taken to a place of safety by his fear
How many [times has] a seriously ill person been saved while a healthy person died!
For every absence, there is a return
NULL

Wisdom: مَنْ عَجَزَ عَنْ أَعْمَالِهِ أَدْبَرَ فِي أَحْوَالِهِ
enWisdom: One who is incapable of performing his actions falls behind in his circumstances [and does not make progress]

Wisdom: مَنْ رَغِبَ فِي حَيَاتِكَ فَقَدْ تَعَلَّقَ بِجِبَالِكَ
enWisdom: One who desires that you remain alive has clutched on to your cord
From idleness comes inclination towards [vain] desire
With idleness there is inclination towards [vain] desire
Successfully attaining what is sought is part of felicity
He who seeks what is best [in his actions] does not regret
Not every seeker fails
To everyone who shoots hits the mark
Not everything that has gone comes back
Not everyone who is enthralled is reproached

Wisdom: مَا بَقَاءُ فَرْعٍ بَعْدَ ذَهَابِ أَصْلٍ
enWisdom: How will the offshoot remain after the root has gone?
The one who publicizes an immoral act is like the one who has committed it
What a good purifier earth is!

Wisdom: هُمْ أُسَرَاءُ إِيمَانٍ لَمْ يَفُكَّهُمْ مِنْهُ زَيْغٌ وَلَا عُدُولٌ
enWisdom: He (‘a) said about angels: They are captives of faith; neither divergence nor deviation breaks them from its hold

Wisdom: هَيْهَاتَ مِنْ نَيْلِ السَّعَادَةِ السُّكُونُ إِلَى الْهُوَيْنَا وَالْبَطَالَةِ
enWisdom: How far is repose in ease and inactivity from acquiring felicity!

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَطِلْ عَلَى مَنْ لَا تَسْتَرِقُّ
enWisdom: Do not be haughty with the one whom you have not enslaved
Do not corrupt the thing whose rectitude is important for you
One who is disproved has no right
There is no cheerfulness with annoyance
No one is more courageous than an innocent person

Wisdom: لَا ازْدِجَارَ لِمَنْ لَا إِقْلَاعَ لَهُ
enWisdom: He who has no desistance has no restraint

Wisdom: لَا حَمِيَّةَ لِمَنْ لَا أَنْفَةَ لَهُ
enWisdom: There is no vehemence in one who has no sense of honour
